message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.DS 

This paper proposes a novel method for learning the class structure for multi-class classification problems. The method involves a maximum separating margin approach to determine the child nodes of any internal node in a binary hierarchical tree. This approach is commonly used in machine learning and falls under the category of supervised learning, which is covered by the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The proposed method is evaluated on real-world large-scale problems, which suggests that it may also fall under the sub-categories of cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the method involves the use of a hierarchical tree structure, which is a common data structure in computer science and may fall under the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
